page.title: 01D BLOCK 03600411
page.content:
This D Block includes the north west tip of the Greater Manchester conurbation in its south east corner, whilst a swathe of green belt holds the middle ground before we reach the Lancashire village of Adlington to the north west.
The most remarkable feature might be the great Lower Rivington reservoir in the east but an aerial view will bring out the significance of the M61 motorway which almost bisects the block from north to south as well as the landscaped acres of the great Viscount Leverhulme's legacy of Rivington Country Park.
The following pages will refer in detail to these features and to the people of Horwich, Blackrod and Adlington.
